title: Is selling a summoner name against the rules?
body:
if not, Selling mine <3 
if so, Im NOT selling mine :^) :^) :^) ^_^ ayyeee

replies.body:
selling my virginity 

no offers under 800keys

If they buy it from you just with the RP gift required to name change it would be fine because it still stays all within the client and technically would be
->They gift you RP
->You decide you want to spend it on a name change
->They name change to your old name
None of these things are against the rules therefore it is allowed, however if actual real life money or goods come into play that is when it would break the EULA as you are selling things in Riots game for real life money
not that anybody cares, played every big game in the last 15 yrs, hasn't stopped anybody from trying, and in most cases suceeding
My assumption would be it's against the rules because it's part of your account.

it's not against the rules. why would it be? someone wants your name, they can give you money for a name change, you change your name, and they get your old one.
My assumption is he means he want's money on top of the name change cost, which is unlikely to be allowed.

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=6JyPc7Eo,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-06-07T02:52:01.068+0000)
>
> My assumption is he means he want's money on top of the name change cost, which is unlikely to be allowed.

no, it's perfectly allowed. Why would someone change their name, with the other person paying for it, just cause someone else wants it? that's like having someone build a house as long as you pay for the building supplies only.

Yes which is debatable to whether or not it's allowed.

Fact is i would say riot would be against this sort of a thing just by principle.

I'd say this is a bit of an ambiguous topic. On one hand your summoner name is, technically, not owned by Riot but on the other it's one of the key identifying aspects of your account. Looking at the TOU and EULA it would probably come under "Ownership" and actually be against the rules, as far as I can tell.

It's probably a good idea to contact support about this topic.
